result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt D Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurt D Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurt D Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: COMMITMENT ORDER RETURNED
JOC
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Kurt D Johnson in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 12 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 9 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on June 1, 2017

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT: Set for Trial

Defendant Kurt D Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.  Court confirms defendant's address.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with the victim A.H.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial  Return date scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 09:45 am.
